block.p: To the Editor: Having encountered hundreds of ex-military who served in Boston in World War II, I have yet to have one ask about the swan boats or Fenway Park. Practically all, however, can recall escapades in Scollay Square. The ''sin squad'' was a facade behind which the real Boston offered as much as any other major city in night life.

To the Editor: Having encountered hundreds of ex-military who served in Boston in World War II, I have yet to have one ask about the swan boats or Fenway Park. Practically all, however, can recall escapades in Scollay Square. The ''sin squad'' was a facade behind which the real Boston offered as much as any other major city in night life.

Has the author, Martha Weinman Lear, forgotten the Statler, the Madison at North Station and the Touraine on the corner of Tremont Street and Boylston Street, where my brother and his bride retired for the evening following their wedding?
